quest.name: Going the Distance
journal: Broken Mountain is beside himself with worry.

Curious Gorge has disappeared, but not without a trace. According to Wyrnzoen, a man matching his description recently boarded a ship bound eastward. Broken Mountain is certain his brother has run off in search of Dorgono at the Azim Steppe. Unable to leave his post in Limsa Lominsa, he asks you to search for Curious Gorge and see that he does not come to harm.

You travel east to the Azim Steppe, and question the people of a small settlement known as Reunion. While many could not distinguish Curious Gorge from the many travelers passing through, one merchant recalls a large, axe-wielding Roegadyn heading west in search of a Qerel settlement.
Curious Gorge was moments away from evisceration when you stepped in to rescue him from a ravenous weasel. He seems no worse for wear as you help him to his feet.
You are relieved to see Curious Gorge is without injury, but there is no time for small talk. Dorgono's people are under attack, and so Curious Gorge rushes off to the west.

You arrive to find Dorgono looking over the ruin of her people's settlement. As she tells it, they are safe and sound at Reunion. Sadly, there would be no homecoming for Dorgono. The ones responsible for besieging their homes were the very same people they exiled from the Qerel clan. They have created an order of their own, the Chaghan, and believe the blind fury of their inner beasts is a gift from their goddess, the Dusk Mother. The Qerel believe Dorgono to be one of the Chaghan now, and refuse to allow her back. She is now determined to avenge her people and earn back their trust. Your help, and even Curious Gorge's, will be indispensable in this endeavor. As she leaves to go track their whereabouts, she suggests you return to Reunion to rest up and prepare for battle.

You speak with Curious Gorge at Reunion, and it seems he has yet to realize the source of his problems. With battle looming on the horizon, one can only hope he comes to terms with his emotions before the fighting begins.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 70.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: He's gone! My brother is gone!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I spoke with Wyrnzoen, and his men claim to have seen a man fitting Brother's description boarding a ship heading to the Far East.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The lovestruck fool. No doubt he's run off to find Dorgono.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: In his weakened state, there's no telling what misfortune may find him there. Would that I could go and search of him, but I cannot leave my post here in Limsa.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It shames me to ask more of you, but do you think it possible you could find him?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Bless you, Forename. If he is searching for Dorgono, then he is making for the Azim Steppe.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If the plains are as vast as she claimed, you would do well to find the closest settlement and begin your search there. If the gods are kind, someone will have seen him.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Forename. I pray he causes no more trouble than he already has.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If Dorgono told it true, the plains of Azim Steppe are vast and fraught with peril. When you arrive, make haste to the nearest settlement and see what you can learn of my brother's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: TAMACHAG
dialogue.text: A large man with an axe? You've any idea how many brutes with axes come stomping through these parts?

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: A burly, red-faced Roegadyn? Yes, I remember. He was asking after the Qerel clan, but they haven't lived here in ages.

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: Ah, that unruly fellow in search of the Qerel clan? If he took my advice, he's headed due west to search for their settlement. Or what's left of it.

dialogue.name: TAMACHAG
dialogue.text: A large man with an axe on his back? You'll have to be more specific. There's no shortage of axe-wielding types here.

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: If you're looking for the Qerel, you'll not find them here. I told that boisterous Roegadyn the same.

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: I can't say what you'll find to the west, but it's likely not the Qerel.

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Thank you, kind stranger. Had you not arrived, I would have─Forename!? Wh-What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ack, that can wait. Dorgono's people are under attack. Come, we have to help them!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Dorgono is safe, but where are the others?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename, you've come! Hope is not yet lost... Though I fail to see why you chose to bring the worm.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Worm!? Why, I... You... Ugh, could you just tell us what happened here?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The Qerel settlement was attacked, but I was too late. This is all there was to be seen when I arrived. You needn't worry, though. They escaped.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I managed to track them back to Reunion. Upon finding them, however, I was greeted with looks of fear and disgust. They would only suffer me long enough to explain the will of Karash is to blame for their woes.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The exiles of Qerel have created a clan of their own─the Chaghan. They offered me shelter when I was first cast out.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Where the Qerel see the will of Karash as a source of rack and ruin, the Chaghan praise it as a blessing from the Dusk Mother.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: They commit all manner of heinous acts when Karash takes hold. Some would even slay their own kin and claim it in the name of the Mother. I could not abide their savagery and soon left. Still, my people mistake me for one of the Chaghan now.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: After all that work, all that training, they would deny me. But I cannot give up! I will avenge my people and earn their trust!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your opponents are warriors who freely indulge in their inner beasts. You do not stand a chance alone. I will help you!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I have no need of your aid, worm. You would only get in my way with your wriggling and writhing.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename's proven axe, on the other hand, would be welcome. What say you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you lend Dorgono your strength?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you. Your presence alone is worth a hundred warriors!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I...I see. Then I have no choice but to face them alone...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What are you saying? The Forename I know would never let a comrade rush headlong into danger alone. You must help Dorgono!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you. Your presence alone is worth a hundred warriors!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aye, and with me at your side, that's another hundred at your disposal. Dealing with the Chaghan should be as child's play.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Do as you like. I only ask you don't slow us down.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: For now, return to Reunion and rest. The Chaghan have grown careless and should prove easy for me to track. When the time comes, I expect you to be ready, Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Huh? I mean, r-right. You can count on me!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I should not be long, Forename. Soon we will put an end to their madness.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: That woman is insufferable! She's arrogant, rude, pigheaded... <sigh> And she finally called me by name...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ahem. She is also right. Battle against the Chaghan would be folly in my present condition. Let us return to Reunion.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename. Let me speak plain: why exactly are you here?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Brother worries about me, does he? It seems I've made good company of trouble in recent days.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ever since I was bested by Dorgono at the pier, everything has gone wrong. My inner beast remains dormant, and my ability to fight along with it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: There are moments when my blood quickens, and I dare to hope that the inner beast would awaken...only to find myself racked by visions of Dorgono and my strength abandoning me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I know not what is going on inside me, know not how to conquer it. I knew only that I had to follow Dorgono. What in heavens' name is wrong with me?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I think you're in love with Dorgono.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You need to train harder and regain your focus.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: L-Love!? I was hoping you would offer me counsel, not cruel jests.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Could it be as simple as that? I confess I have felt rather unfocused of late, but I'm not so certain it is a mere matter of training.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: <sigh> What am I doing, bothering you with this? I'm sure you have a veritable mountain of troubles of your own to contend with.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: In any case, this problem is my burden. It will not be solved by thrusting it upon others.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: And if I am to be ready for our battle, it must be solved quickly.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I won't keep you any longer, Forename. Do what you must to prepare, and I shall do the same.
